metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7464 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In csrf-magic before 1.0.4, if $GLOBALS['csrf']['secret'] is not configured, the Anti-CSRF Token used is predictable and would permit an attacker to bypass the CSRF protections, because an automatically generated secret is not used.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8b+dfsg-6
No subscription required

notes.Note: pfsmorigo> CVE-2014-2327 overwrites the affected code and fixes it. Trusty has this CVE included and it was backported upstream at version 0.8.8c.

criterions.comment: cacti package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8b+dfsg-6').
